page.title: 02SUMMARY OF AREA (CONT'D)
page.content: LEEK HAS A COLLEGE OF FURTHER EDUCATION WHICH SERVES NOT ONLY LEEK BUT ALSO THE SURROUNDING AREA AND OFFERS A WIDE VARIETY OF COURSES TO MANY STUDENTS. IN LEEK ITSELF THERE ARE THE NICHOLSON INSTITUTE - A MUSEUM AND ART GALLERY AND THE BRINDLEY MILL (BELIEVED TO HAVE BEEN THE WORKSHOP OF JAMES BRINDLEY THE CANAL ENGINEER) WHICH ARE WELL WORTH A VISIT. AS LEEK IS ON THE EDGE OF DOVEDALE AND THE PEAK DISTRICT NATIONAL PARK THERE ARE MANY PLACES OF SCENIC BEAUTY AGAIN WHICH ARE WELL WORTH VISITING. LEEK IS AN INTERESTING MIXTURE OF INDUSTRIAL AND RURAL WHICH COMBINE TO GIVE THE TOWN ITS UNIQUE ATMOSPHERE.LEEK ALSO HAS AN ENTRY IN THE ORIGINAL DOMESDAY BOOK.
